trans-unit.source: Handle app activation
trans-unit.target: Handle app activation

trans-unit.source: Learn how to handle app activation by overriding the OnLaunched method.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to handle app activation by overriding the OnLaunched method.

trans-unit.source: Handle app activation
trans-unit.target: Handle app activation

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: OnLaunched
trans-unit.target: OnLaunched

trans-unit.source: Learn how to handle app activation by overriding the [**OnLaunched**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242335) method..
trans-unit.target: Learn how to handle app activation by overriding the [**OnLaunched**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242335) method..

trans-unit.source: Override the launch handler
trans-unit.target: Override the launch handler

trans-unit.source: When an app is activated, for any reason, the system sends the [**Activated**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225018) event.
trans-unit.target: When an app is activated, for any reason, the system sends the [**Activated**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225018) event.

trans-unit.source: For a list of activation types, see the [**ActivationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224693) enumeration.
trans-unit.target: For a list of activation types, see the [**ActivationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224693) enumeration.

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.UI.Xaml.Application**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242324) class defines methods you can override to handle the various activation types.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.UI.Xaml.Application**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242324) class defines methods you can override to handle the various activation types.

trans-unit.source: Several of the activation types have a specific method that you can override.
trans-unit.target: Several of the activation types have a specific method that you can override.

trans-unit.source: For the other activation types, override the [**OnActivated**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242330) method.
trans-unit.target: For the other activation types, override the [**OnActivated**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242330) method.

trans-unit.source: Define the class for your application.
trans-unit.target: Define the class for your application.

trans-unit.source: Override the [**OnLaunched**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242335) method.
trans-unit.target: Override the [**OnLaunched**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242335) method.

trans-unit.source: This method is called whenever the user launches the app.
trans-unit.target: This method is called whenever the user launches the app.

trans-unit.source: The [**LaunchActivatedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224731) parameter contains the previous state of your app and the activation arguments.
trans-unit.target: The [**LaunchActivatedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224731) parameter contains the previous state of your app and the activation arguments.

trans-unit.source: **Note** For Windows Phone Store apps, this method is called each time the user launches the app from Start tile or app list, even when the app is currently suspended in memory.
trans-unit.target: **Note** For Windows Phone Store apps, this method is called each time the user launches the app from Start tile or app list, even when the app is currently suspended in memory.

trans-unit.source: On Windows, launching a suspended app from Start tile or app list doesn’t call this method.
trans-unit.target: On Windows, launching a suspended app from Start tile or app list doesn’t call this method.

trans-unit.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
trans-unit.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

trans-unit.source: Restore application data if app was suspended then terminated
trans-unit.target: Restore application data if app was suspended then terminated

trans-unit.source: When the user switches to your terminated app, the system sends the [**Activated**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225018) event, with [**Kind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224728) set to **Launch** and [**PreviousExecutionState**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224729) set to **Terminated** or **ClosedByUser**.
trans-unit.target: When the user switches to your terminated app, the system sends the [**Activated**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225018) event, with [**Kind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224728) set to **Launch** and [**PreviousExecutionState**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224729) set to **Terminated** or **ClosedByUser**.

trans-unit.source: The app should load its saved application data and refresh its displayed content.
trans-unit.target: The app should load its saved application data and refresh its displayed content.

trans-unit.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
trans-unit.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

trans-unit.source: If the value of [**PreviousExecutionState**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224729) is **NotRunning**, the app failed to save its application data successfully and the app should start over as if it were being initially launched.
trans-unit.target: If the value of [**PreviousExecutionState**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224729) is **NotRunning**, the app failed to save its application data successfully and the app should start over as if it were being initially launched.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: **Note** For Windows Phone Store apps, the [**Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242339) event is always followed by [**OnLaunched**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242335), even when your app is currently suspended and the user re-launches your app from a primary tile or app list.
trans-unit.target: **Note** For Windows Phone Store apps, the [**Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242339) event is always followed by [**OnLaunched**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242335), even when your app is currently suspended and the user re-launches your app from a primary tile or app list.

trans-unit.source: Apps can skip initialization if there is already content set on the current window.
trans-unit.target: Apps can skip initialization if there is already content set on the current window.

trans-unit.source: You can check the [**LaunchActivatedEventArgs.TileId**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224736) property to determine if the app was launched from a primary or a secondary tile and, based on that information, decide whether you should present a fresh or resume app experience.
trans-unit.target: You can check the [**LaunchActivatedEventArgs.TileId**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224736) property to determine if the app was launched from a primary or a secondary tile and, based on that information, decide whether you should present a fresh or resume app experience.
